column4: I did a default install of Ubuntu 5.1 and I'm getting this error when I try to do a JAR install of JEdit: Exception in thread "main" java.awt.AWTError: Cannot load AWT toolkit: gnu.java.awt.peer.gtk.GtkToolkit
Can anyone suggest how to get around it?
search synaptic for gtk and java, there are gtk bindings for java you probably need to install
Thanks. :)

Did what you suggested and now I get this when I run the jEdit installer: ** ERROR **: file ../../../src/libjava/jni/gtk-peer/gnu_java_awt_peer_gtk_GtkImage.c: line 572 (createRawData): assertion failed: (data_fid != 0)
I would talk to the Jedit people
K, thanks. Don't suppose you have any suggest as to why Ubuntu sees my Creative MuVo 256 MB as a "973.8 MB Removable Volume?"
well my Muve 64MB is seen as a "removable volume" but I don't know why it is messing up the size so much
Hm... K, thanks.
have you refreshed your sources since you've updated your repos?
If you mean doing sudo apt-get update then yes.
I would double check your repos and make sure multiverse isn't commented out
OK, uncommented the multiverse lines, did an update (and actually got updates this time), did an upgrade, and then tried the same command again and got the same error.
Uncommented multiverse lines in /etc/apt/sources.list, updated, upgraded, ran sudo apt-get install fakeroot java-package java-common, and I'm still getting E: Couldn't find package java-package.
pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/12929
if you do apt-cache search java-package does it show up?
Command runs, but no output.
pastebin the output of apt-get update
thoreauputic: Took thoreauputic's suggestion and it seems to be working now. Thanks to both of you.
install mplayer-fonts
thoreauputic: Hm... odd how it doesn't include that as a dependency. Thanks guys. :P
